notesStmt.note: Lacuna after folio 190 due to a missing bifolio from the middle of quire xxiv (the missing text: Isaiah 38:9-42:4).
Notes in Latin with some Greek on the content (early modern) (folio 424v). Small pieces of leather are glued to the parchment to mark the beginning of each biblical book.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Former and Latter Prophets and Hagiographa, punctuated and accentuated, with masorah magna and parva.

collation.p: 53 quires: i8+1 (folios 1-9), ii8 (folios 10-17), iii8 (folios18-25), iv8 (folios 26-33), v8 (folios 34-41), vi8 (folios 42-49), vii8 (folios 50-57), viii8 (folios 58-65), ix8 (folios 66-73), x8 (folios 74-81), xi8 (folios 82-89), xii8 (folios 90-97), xiii8 (folios 98-105), xiv8 (folios 106-113), xv8 (folios 114-121), xvi10 (folios 122-131), xvii8 (folios 132-139), xviii8 (folios 140-147), xix8 (folios 148-155), xx8 (folios 156-163), xxi8 (folios 164-171), xxii8 (folios 172-179), xxiii8 (folios 180-187), xxiv8-2 (folios 188-193), xxv8 (folios 194-201), xxvi8 (folios 202-209), xxvii8 (folios 210-217), xxviii8 (folios 218-225), xxix8 (folios 226-233), xxx8 (folios 234-241), xxxi8 (folios 242-249), xxxii8 (folios 250-257), xxxiii8 (folios 258-265), xxxiv10 (folios 266-275), xxxv8 (folios 276-283), xxxvi8 (folios 284-291), xxxvii8 (folios 292-299), xxxviii8 (folios 300-307), xxxix8 (folios 308-315), xl8 (folios 316-323), xli8 (folios 324-331), xlii8 (folios 332-339), xliii8 (folios 340-347), xliv12 (folios 348-359), xlv8 (folios 360-367), xlvi8 (folios 368-375), xlvii8 (folios 376-383), xlviii8 (folios 384-391), xlix8 (folios 392-399), l8 (folios 400-407), li8 (folios 408-415), lii6-3 (folios 416-418), liii6 (folios 419-424). Catchwords on the last page of the quire.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Ashkenazi square script, main text is punctuated, masorah is unpunctuated. The 2nd half of the 13th century.

decoDesc.decoNote: 30 micrographic designs at the beginning of chapters. Carmina figurata on several folios. Catchwords enclosed within pen and ink drawings of figures, usually animals.

binding.p: Pre-1600 (dated: 1524). Stamped vellum over wooden boards, with brass clasps, corners, and bosses.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Purchased by the British Museum in 1879.
